title: 'How many Foreign Secretaries does it take?', asks Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe after six-year ordeal
maintext:
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe asked "how many Foreign Secretaries does it take for someone to come home?" as she claimed Britain's delay in paying back its debt to Iran held back her release.
Speaking in public for the first time after her return home, the British-Iranian dual national criticised the fact it took five changes of Foreign Secretary before she was freed, telling a press conference: "What happened now should have happened six years ago."
Ms Zaghari-Ratcliffe said that Iranian authorities had told her she would not be released unless Britain paid off a debt of nearly £400 million dating back to 1979, and that they had kept their word.
Asked whether the debt held back her release, she said: "Yes. I was told early on that there is something they want [off] the Brits, and they're not going to let me go until such time as they get that. I didn't know the details at the time."
The 43-year-old thanked her "amazing, wonderful" husband Richard for "tirelessly" campaigning over her release and her daughter Gabriella "for being very, very patient with mummy to be coming home".
